intro: Roettlera teres, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, urn-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Roettlera teres typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
